summary: This document is a chain of internal email correspondence among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and contractors regarding the preparation of supplemental discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails discuss technical tasks like stamping documents, converting video/audio files, and drafting a cover letter in response to defense counsel.

persons.name: Everdell
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of a response letter; appears to be Maxwell's defense counsel.

persons.name: Will
persons.context: Asked to shoot over a draft of a cover letter for the discovery production.

connections.description: M is instructed to handle cover letter revisions to include a response to Everdell's recent letter, indicating an attorney-client relationship between Everdell and Maxwell, and an adversarial legal relationship with the prosecution.

events.title: Discovery Production Preparation
events.description: Final preparations for a supplemental discovery production in the Maxwell case, including converting PBPD surveillance video footage and stamping documents.

events.title: Notice of Supplemental Discovery
events.description: Prosecution notifies contractors of plans to make a supplemental discovery production in a few weeks, after a superseding indictment, and provides advance materials including problematic audio files.

keyFacts: The prosecution was preparing a supplemental discovery production for Ghislaine Maxwell's case in March-April 2021.
The materials included PBPD (Palm Beach Police Department) surveillance video footage that needed conversion to a viewable format.
The production included American Express records ('Amex production') and audio files that were noted to potentially have issues.
The correspondence references a planned superseding indictment preceding the supplemental discovery production.
The emails show coordination between SDNY prosecutors/contractors and a response to defense counsel Everdell.
